124 // Must include this header file to use the Mutation++ library
125 #include "mutation++.h"
126 
127 using namespace Mutation;
128 using namespace Mutation::Thermodynamics;
129 using namespace std;
130 
131 // Prints the header of the output table
132 void printHeader(const Mixture& mix)
133 {
134  cout << setw(8) << "Time[s]";
135  cout << setw(12) << "T[K]";
136  cout << setw(12) << "P[Pa]";
137  cout << setw(12) << "rho[kg/m^3]";
138  cout << setw(12) << "e[J/kg]";
139  for (int i = 0; i < mix.nSpecies(); ++i)
140  cout << setw(12) << "Y_" + mix.speciesName(i);
141  cout << endl;
142 }
143 
144 // Prints the mixture properties at the given time
145 void printResults(double time, const Mixture& mix)
146 {
147  cout << setw(8) << time;
148  cout << setw(12) << mix.T();
149  cout << setw(12) << mix.P();
150  cout << setw(12) << mix.density();
151  cout << setw(12) << mix.mixtureEnergyMass();
152  for (int i = 0; i < mix.nSpecies(); ++i)
153  cout << setw(12) << mix.Y()[i];
154  cout << endl;
155 }
156 
157 // Main entry point
158 int main()
159 {
160  // Initial conditions are defined here
161  const double T_init = 4000.0; // K
162  const double rho_init = 2.85e-4; // kg/m^3
163 
164  // First create the mixture object
165  MixtureOptions opts;
166  opts.setSpeciesDescriptor("O O2"); // 2 species O2 mixture
167  opts.setThermodynamicDatabase("RRHO"); // Thermo database is RRHO
168  opts.setMechanism("O2"); // O2 + M = 2O + M
169  opts.setStateModel("ChemNonEq1T"); // chemical noneq. w/ 1T
170  Mixture mix(opts); // Init. the mixture with opts
171 
172  // Setup arrays
173  double rhoi [mix.nSpecies()];
174  double wdot [mix.nSpecies()];
175 
176  // Set state of mixture to the initial conditions
177  rhoi[mix.speciesIndex("O")] = 0.0;
178  rhoi[mix.speciesIndex("O2")] = rho_init;
179  mix.setState(rhoi, &T_init, 1); // set state using {rho_i, T}
180 
181  // Get the mixture energy which is conserved during the simulation
182  double etot = mix.mixtureEnergyMass() * mix.density(); // J/m^3
183 
184  // Write the results header and initial conditions
185  printHeader(mix);
186  printResults(0.0, mix);
187 
188  // Integrate the species mass conservation equations forward in time
189  double dt = 0.0;
190  double time = 0.0;
191  double tout = 0.0001;
192 
193  while (time < 100.0) {
194  // Get the species production rates
195  mix.netProductionRates(wdot);
196 
197  // Compute "stable" time-step based on maximum allowed change in
198  // species densities
199  dt = 0.0;
200  for (int i = 0; i < mix.nSpecies(); ++i)
201  dt += 1.0e-7 * std::abs(rho_init * mix.Y()[i] / wdot[i]);
202  dt = min(dt / mix.nSpecies(), tout-time);
203 
204  // Integrate in time
205  for (int i = 0; i < mix.nSpecies(); ++i)
206  rhoi[i] += wdot[i]*dt;
207  time += dt;
208 
209  // Set the new state of the mixture (using conserved variables)
210  mix.setState(rhoi, &etot);
211 
212  // Print results at specified time intervals
213  if (std::abs(tout-time) < 1.0e-10) {
214  printResults(time, mix);
215 
216  if (tout > 9.9) tout += 10.0;
217  else if (tout > 0.99) tout += 1.0;
218  else if (tout > 0.099) tout += 0.1;
219  else if (tout > 0.0099) tout += 0.01;
220  else if (tout > 0.00099) tout += 0.001;
221  else tout += 0.0001;
222  }
223  }
224 
225  // Now get the equilibrium values
226  mix.equilibriumComposition(mix.T(), mix.P(), rhoi); // puts X_i in rhoi
227  mix.convert<X_TO_Y>(rhoi, rhoi); // converts X_i to Y_i
228 
229  cout << "Equilibrium mass fractions at " << mix.T() << " K and "
230  << mix.P() << " Pa:" << endl;
231 
232  for (int i = 0; i < mix.nSpecies(); ++i)
233  cout << setw(15) << mix.speciesName(i) << ":"
234  << setw(15) << rhoi[i] << endl;
235 
236  return 0;
237 }
